intro: Canthium greenwayi, commonly known as the greenway's spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with palmately lobed leaves. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in cyathia, a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. Canthium greenwayi is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
